After finishing or going through on this course again, I hate to give a bad review to a course that has hours of dedication to it, but this review is based on this course. 
This course is helpful to review concepts of different languages and applications but unfortunately instructor gets these concepts from Wikipedia and he doesn't explain it on his own for the most part. 
Most of the lessons states on the obvious. There is no real organization plan or work project to follow along and to learn. It would have been interesting if he worked on a mock up page from scratch. 
One good thing I learned from this course were good freelance gig sites to work, and some good html tool applications out there that were in the first lessons.

response.content: Wikipedia is only used as a reference so students can learn more about the topics and if they want to learn about history.  Its only provided for further reading.  The course is over 22 hours of content which demonstrates source code and how to use coding syntax.  HTML CSS JavaScript jQuery Bootstrap PHP mySQL...  and much more all in one course
response.content_html: Wikipedia is only used as a reference so students can learn more about the topics and if they want to learn about history. Its only provided for further reading. The course is over 22 hours of content which demonstrates source code and how to use coding syntax. HTML CSS JavaScript jQuery Bootstrap PHP mySQL... and much more all in one course

results.content:
Good pace. Monotone voice loses listener's attention. Presented too many editor options without a conclusion, such as recommending one or two as a starting point.
The instructor forgets who the audience is and uses words and terms without defining them. It is more like a casual chat that wanders among topics, instead of a structured, thought out  training course.
The instructor uses a mouse to point to full screen web pages, making it impossible to read the fine print.

response.content: what editor to use is a suggestion and not for the instructor to determine what you will like to use.  The course is over 20 hours and defines all the terms used within it.  The topics are based around learning from start to finish and planned out.
response.content_html: what editor to use is a suggestion and not for the instructor to determine what you will like to use. The course is over 20 hours and defines all the terms used within it. The topics are based around learning from start to finish and planned out.
